name: Sofitel Angkor Phokeethra Golf and Spa Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly - in Cambodia there are a few choices of accomodation and many cheaper options are fine but be aware that you are in a country that has extreme poverty, you cant drink the water etc and for health and security (and because we are Advantage Plus Members and got good discounts) we chose to stay at the Sofitel in Siem Reap.
reviews.title: Will def return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are going to stay at an Accor hotel in Australasia def join the Advantage Plus, we used our free night for one of our nights there and our 50% off dining for breakfast lunch and dinner for all three days - the Citadel Resturant was fantastic - staff lovely and very professional (give many service staff in AUS a run for their money!) and the buffet (which we ate mostly at) was a large choice, rotated reguarly for freshness and perfectly fine to eat at.
reviews.title: Idealic Retreat Between Temple Tours

likes.liked: — Standard of service, comfort and beauty of hotel surroundings.

reviews.title: Nice but very pricey
reviews.text: Room was very comfy - we were in a superior room - shower was lovely and one of the few Sofitels i have come across that provide a laundry line in bathroom - when your out at the temples all day your clothes become soaked in Sweat and the need to change reguarly means you also need to wash frequently.

reviews.title: Beauty In the Beast
reviews.text: Overall a great hotel we will go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 6 nights as part of a multi centre holiday in SE Asia.
reviews.title: Excellent base for touring temples

reviews.text: Sofitel must be located in one of the best settings, it has a huge garden with lakes and swimming pools. Rooms are large, if you get upgraded like us, you even have an espresso machine. I really enjoyed my time there, especially to relax after the Angkor temples, which makes you very tired when its 40degrees outside!
reviews.title: Great settings, food is average

reviews.text: On the negative side, food on one evening was average, they serve you an outside buffet, but with the heat, careful as what you eat as it can go off very quickly and some items were missing. Breakfast buffet has a large variety, but orange juice is not fresh.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Otherwise, i would recommend this hotel, as it has amazing settings compared to others which are usually by the river and dont offer as much space.
reviews.title: Loved the Sofitel Angkor - close to ruins and nice service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a terrific hotel. Beautiful grounds; friendly, extremely helpful staff; great food. When you enter, the grounds look like a luxurious Hawaiian resort carried across the Pacific ocean. The rooms are lovely, large with beautiful wooden floors. There is a charming Khmer dance show outdoors every night. The breads and pastries are excellent as are the spring rolls. The place is an oasis. I cannot imagine anyone who would not like it.
reviews.title: Big and Spacious Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I stayed three nights at the Royal Sofitel Angkor during our visit to Cambodia three weeks ago. We were blown away by the hotel. When we entered the large and sprawling lobby we were greeted with fresh flowers, a very cold drink, and cold facial towels. Staff took care of our luggage and had them in our room before we even got there.
reviews.title: Excellent service, good location, but wouldnt call it a golf resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Sofitel for 5 nights and enjoyed every minute of it. There was a mix up in our airport transfer and it was basically my fault. I had inquired about rates etc but did not actually confirm that I wanted a pick up but yet they showed up at the airport. And when I told the driver I had made alternative arrangements he was still all smiles and very polite. This speaks greatly to the level of service at the Sofitel. The staff were always very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great hotel with excellent service

likes.liked: — The staff and the comfort level

reviews.text: Although right outside the hotel there seems to be a flurry of people and activity, the hotel itself is tranquil and quiet. They have a large pool with a bar/restaurant, we enjoyed our poolside lunches there. The rooms were large and comfortable with a nice view of the lake.
reviews.title: Loved the Sofitel

reviews.text: Stayed there 2 nights during our tour of Angkor in 2008. The soothing sounds of a girl playing a local instrument in the lobby was a nice touch during the check-in. Being a resort at the edge of the little town next to the Meridien and children's hospital, it had extensive and beautifully landscaped grounds with a lake and statues. No complaints about the room which had a lovely bathroom. Was a pity that we didn't try the resort's restaurants or see their night cultural performance during our stay.
reviews.title: a luxury in siem reap

reviews.text: We stayed for four days. Very convenient to the airport and the city. The hotel staff were all super friendly. We went to Angkor Wat, the lake and then the quad bike easy ride trip. All three were worth it.
reviews.title: Friendly
We Loved it!
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our 5 night stay! The room was lovely,the sevice was excellent and the meals were fantastic! The staff really looked after us, nothing was too much trouble! Even though the hotel is a little out of town, it only costs about $2 US for the Tuk Tuk ride to the markets. Thank you Sofitel, we hope to be back!

Whilst staying in Cambodia we stayed at the Sofitel Angkor Phokeethra. During our stay there was flooding both in the town and at the temples. Our stay was made memorable due to the magnificant grounds and facilities at the resort. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and assisted us in all our needs, we could not have asked for better service and assistance.
reviews.title: An enjoyable Stay
Thoroughly Enjoyable
reviews.text: The rooms were magnificant and spacious and gave an air of tranquility.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for chinese new year (end of Jan) and we really liked the hotel. As many others have said on this site, the service is excellent and its in a good location. It also has a huge pool which was normally empty everyday! However we were disappointed with the 'golf resort' as the hotel itself does not have a golf course on site! the golf course they take you to is a country club golf course (which i think most hotels will offer) and its quite a way out (past the airport, over 30mins). The golf course is very nice and we were the only ones on it, however the caddys didnt speak english so dont expect advice when taking a shot! The cost of a round was also quite expensive considering your in Cambodia ( I think it was $120 USD for 9 holes).
reviews.title: Charming hotel

reviews.text: A charming hotel in a great position for access to Angkor Wat and to Siem Reap, both just a tuk tuk ride away. As an AClub Platinum Card holder we were upgraded to a lovely suite and given free drinks and pastries but I think they make a fuss of everybody with flowers and fruit on arrival. The New Years Eve celebrations were also charming with the staff genuinely wanting people to have a good time. Great fireworks at midnight. Nice pool area and grounds. The hotel tends to be quiet because people are out and about. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The Sofitel is a great hotel from which to explore the temples of the area.
reviews.title: Very good location, good value and excellent service

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this resort hotel for three nights in November. This Sofitel is a terrific place to stay. The rooms are well appointed and the grounds are beautiful and well-maintained. The dinner and breakfast buffets serve a broad range of menu items. The Angkor sites are within 20 minutes of the hotel and the downtown a short tuk-tuk ride away (perhaps five minutes). Each evening, the hotel left a small gift to remember our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the Sofitel Angkor Phokeethra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very beautiful hotel and very pleasant and available staff.
reviews.title: Really nice

reviews.text: The breakfast seems expensive but it is very substantial and the buffet always stocked.
reviews.title: Be careful at reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon entering the vast lobby of the Sofitel Angkor one is surrounded by silk clad people bearing fresh scented towels ushering you to a comfotable couch. Then they politely & sweetly advised us that we would not receive the 2 rooms we had paid for in advance, but 1 room. What's more, we'd have to pay extra for a roll away bed for our adult daughter. I asked them to check again. After some minutes they responded that the reservation was for 1 room, when the voucher I showed them clearly stated 2 rooms.
reviews.title: L&M's visit to Angkor

reviews.text: This hotel was great especially as we arrived on the day before the restaurant was back up after being refurbished. The Advantage Plus card was accepted for discounts at one restaurant which is disappointing.
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's hard to descibe the feeling of coming 'home' to such luxury in such an incredibly poor town, but the Sofitel really was gorgeous!
reviews.title: A wonderful base for spectacular Siem Reap

likes.liked: — The gardens, the friendly staff and the food.
likes.disliked: — Noise through ineffective adjoining room doors.

reviews.text: The rooms are spread out across huge gardens and overlook a beautiful, serene lake. Decorated in heritage style, our deluxe room was spacious, incredibly clean and absolutely beautiful - with an ultra comfy king-sized bed! Loved the big balcony and the huge armchair just made for relaxing. Staff did a wonderful job of cleaning and we enjoyed the fresh fruit and flowers.
reviews.title: Loved it before, Love it more now

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at the restaurant one night and had a magnificent buffet, and breakfast was equally elaborate and delicious. The staff were briilliant too, very friendly and happy to chat about their lovely country. Beautiful pool area perfect for a refreshing dip or some quality reading and relaxing in the sun.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The hotel's location was reasonable - about 5 minutes from the main town (including food and markets) by Tuk Tuk (about $2USD for a trip in or out). About the same distance to the entrance to the main temple area.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: The only issues we had related to noise - on the first night a function in the hotel's bar was still pumping well after midnight, making sleep impossible. Then on night three the hotel booked a group of students into the room adjoining ours (those adjoining doors just can't block out crazy screaming and laughter!).
reviews.title: tranquil retreat

reviews.text: The rooms themselves face a beautiful man made lagoon, all standard Sofitel décor. A taxi to the airport costs 20 US, but your better off walking the 20 metres to the street, and paying 10US to a local.
reviews.title: Great roms but overrated

reviews.text: Its difficult to rate this hotel without mentioning the surrounding area, as its integral to the experience. If yo are weak of resolve , don't go to Cambodia, there is a dire need for healthcare and money, and this is constantly in your face.
reviews.title: 5-star or hostel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The sofitel is perfectly located in proximity to Angkor, and you can get taxi driver for the day for about $25
reviews.title: First Rate Hotel

likes.liked: — The hotel rooms, the grounds, the restaurants, the service.
likes.disliked: — The hotel is a bit away from the town of Siem Reap, and it is not easy to simply walk into town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was incredibly pleased with my recent stay at this Sofitel. The resort has truly hired the most gracious and hard-working staff. The grounds were beautiful, peaceful and meticulously maintained. The hotel was conevnient to the Angkor temple complex, and a 5 minute tuk tuk ride away from the main part of town.
reviews.title: Exceptional staff and beautiful grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say enough how fabulous it was to return to the resort after a long day's tour. I highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: A haven of peace and rest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Cambodia to explore Angkor and its magnificent restorations, including Angkor Wat. As we were there "off-season", the humidity was very high and the heat a bit oppressive. However, the Sofitel Angkor staff and grounds made our stay most livable: the grounds are gorgeous and peaceful with lots of ponds/lakes to soothe us. The staff was helpful, friendly and the Cambodian folk dancing performance was elegant and beautifully performed.
reviews.title: The most magnicent resort I have ever been to.

reviews.text: We loved everything about the hotel and Cambodia with one exception. We had made reservations one month ahead in the US for a Cambodian dance/dinner show. When we appeared we were told there was no show. It was too late to catch a show anywhere else. We never got to see something that was a high priority on my itinerary.
reviews.title: Amazing Angkor

reviews.text: My wife and I stay in hotels two to three months out of the year and have traveled all over the world. I can truly say that this is one of the nicest places we have ever stayed. It was named one of the “World’s Best Hotels” last year and it is easy to see why. The rooms were great, the food exceptional, and the grounds and pool were beautiful. But, what really sets this place apart is the friendliness and courtesy of the staff. There seemed to be an attendant at every door waiting to usher us into the air conditioned comfort of the lobby, the bar, one of the many restaurants, or anywhere else we wanted to go. We had occasion to chat with several of the hotel staff members and found that this level of service is a tradition of the hotel. If you have a choice of places to stay in Siem Reap while you visit Angkor Wat or any of the surrounding temples, you couldn’t do better than the Sofitel Angkor.
reviews.title: World Class in Siem Reap

reviews.text: One of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. As a family of 4 we stayed for 4 nights but wished it was longer. The grounds and pool area were stunning, the pool was very kid friendly and my kids very much enjoyed the swim up bar for an afternoon juice. (there is also a kids cubby house).The Staff were so friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Just Perfect

reviews.text: The Explorers Tale bar was very relaxing and had a great range of cocktails at reasonable prices, we also ate there and the food was delicious and portions were generous. The buffet breakfast was very extensive and high quality. The Serpents bar (pool area) was a nice place to have a relaxing lunch.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very nice with lovely hard wood floors. Each day there would be a local gift for us placed in the room, which was a very nice touch.I went to the spa for a much needed foot massage which was so relaxing I almost feel asleep but my feet and legs felt great after.
reviews.title: An oasis of luxury

description: Set in landscaped gardens on Charles de Gaulle Avenue, Sofitel Angkor Phokeethra Golf and Spa Resort is the closest Siem Reap hotel to the ruins of Angkor Wat. This unique Siem Reap Cambodia hotel is situated near traditional markets, tourist attractionsand the airport. Enjoy the many features of Sofitel Angkor Phokeethra Golf and Spa Resort, including 238 rooms, a swimming pool, Jacuzzi, spa, five restaurants, the Phokeethra Country Club, and a world class 18 hole golf course.
